oh D&D last night went pretty well
i managed to trivialize part of the final boss fight
Get any sweet kills?
kinda-
i was responsible for sinking the Soulmonger into the lava while also protecting the entire party
Was it entirely killed by the damage from the lava?
the soulmonger was an artifact- so yes
our mission was to track it down and either turn it off or destroy it
lava is pretty effective
Ahhh, gotcha
it traps all souls in the world and uses them to convert into power used for arcane rituals - it even starts to drain  the souls from living people that had been resurrected at some point
My vote would be tactical nuke on Soulmonger's location
What's the D&D equivalent of a tactical nuke? xD
basically a wizard who had been resurrected was suddenly starting to die- she found out a bunch of other people were also suddenly losing hold of their souls - discovered the source was in Chult
they did some research and hired adventurers to go out into the Jungles of Chult and find it to stop it
Ah, I think I read a bit of the module via the Idle game Wizards made.
Was unfamiliar with it. Soulmonger sounds like a battlemage necromancer-esque character that steals souls
a powerful lich was using it to create some kind of creature that was feeding off of its power
darn liches
always causing trouble
soon as we found it suspended over lava i was like "This thing needs to go in the Lava"
it was way too big to just break- so our druid and cleric put down AOE sustainable spells on the monster and on one of the Struts holding it up
and i used Steel Wind Strike to attack it all- then i got slapped by a tentacle and i was like "never again" and threw up a wall of force
positioned it to block the tentacles but still gave room to attack the strut
Never drag Sage into your Hentai!
it also blocked the monster so they just had to sit there and diiiieeee
a few rounds later we destroy the strut and the other two came loose and it fell into the lava- and shattered from the heat
then the lich came out to mess us up- immediately stopped time and destroyed a bunch of stuff and buffed himself
time started again and my wall of force was gone and he was floating over the lava
Destroyed stuff? Wasn't it in its own lair?
he destroyed the exit
and technically its not his lair
hes using it but its not his XD
what is with this guy and lava
keeping valuables over it, floating over it
yeah Ord- its why I cast dispell magic on him
haha
he should have fallen into the lava- or tried to counter my spell- but the DM instead just said "He appears to have no spells responsible for his ability to fly"
Darn it, he must've been using wires.
which he admitted after it was over that was bullcrap- it was the fly spell but a bunch of resources say "Best to just not let them do this if they figure it out because it ruins the fight"
That could have been handled more elegantly.
not really- theres no magical item that lets you fly that wouldnt be affected as well
Counterspell or Magical Nullification Fields, or Featherfall.
he also didnt have to explain it because i didnt have detect magic up
Alright.
i was a little disappointed i didnt get my Phoenix Down Achievement

killing an enemy with an item or spell that isnt meant to kill
using a Phoenix down in FF on an undead boss is where it comes from
